Description: Rim and floor fragment of a pottery plate on low ring foot; cream slip inside; glaze fired red-brown. Frieze of diagonal lines on top of the rim. On floor, bands and a row of dots, in the centre a large rosette. Exterior, bands at rim, mid-wall and foot, extending over outside of foot; band at outer part of underside of foot.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 226, no. 123)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 114, pl. XXXV, no. 324.8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.66)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4816 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
